channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cuba releases jailed activist Jose Daniel Ferrer
item.description: He spent more than three years in prison following protests that swept through the island in 2021.

item.title: Passenger clings to German high-speed train and survives
item.description: He jumped on when it pulled out of the station before he had finished his smoking break, police say.

item.title: Border app that became ‘a salvation’ for migrants to legally enter the US may end
Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok if it’s not sold by its Chinese parent company
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump says he talked with Chinese leader Xi Jinping about TikTok shortly before the Supreme Court unanimously upheld the federa...

item.title: Man sought after "So I raped you" message denied bail after extradition
item.description: The appearance by Ian Cleary, 31, of Saratoga, California, came a day after he arrived back in the U.S. from France where he was detained in April.

item.title: Driver in Texas migrant smuggling run that led to the deaths of 53 people pleads guilty
Top food trends for 2025 revealed by "Food & Wine"
item.description: "Food & Wine" reveals what's ahead for food in 2025, including trends shaping what we eat and drink.

item.title: US Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban law
item.description: A law passed last year requires TikTok's Chinese parent company to sell the video platform or face a ban.

item.title: Biden says the Equal Rights Amendment is law. What happens next is unclear
item.description: To come into effect, the constitutional amendment would need to be formally published or certified by the National Archivist who has declined to do so...

item.title: Details on Supreme Court's decision to uphold TikTok ban
item.description: The Supreme Court on Friday decided to uphold the law that could force TikTok to go dark in the U.S. on Sunday. CBS News Supreme Court and legal produ...

item.title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban, threatening app's existence in the U.S.
item.description: The decision resolves a long-running legal dispute between the Department of Justice and TikTok. But experts say President-elect Donald Trump will now...

item.title: Supreme Court upholds law that would ban TikTok in the U.S.
item.description: The Supreme Court on Friday upheld a new law that would lead to a ban of the social media platform TikTok.

item.title: Fire at one of the world's largest battery plants forces evacuations in California
item.description: A major fire erupted south of San Francisco at the Moss Landing Power Plant, forcing hundreds to evacuate. So far, the fire has stayed in the facility...

item.title: Food pantries are bracing for more demand if the Trump administration cuts food aid
item.description: The first Trump administration tried to scale back who gets food benefits, and allies aim to try again. Food pantries say they're already busier than ...

item.title: Raids targeting anti-corruption chief rock Hungary's government
item.description: Ferenc Biro is suspected of corruption and abuse of authority but says it is politically motivated.

item.title: Israel's security cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal
item.description: Israel's security cabinet has voted to approve a ceasefire deal to end the fighting in Gaza. Full cabinet approval is expected later today.

item.title: TikTok ban upheld by US Supreme Court: What happens now?
item.description: Could there be ways to bypass the ban - and could president-elect Donald Trump find a way to stop the law?
